segments.en: Linked Discourses 44
1. The Undeclared Points
11. With Sabhiya Kaccāna

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sabhiyo kaccāno ñātike viharati giñjakāvasathe.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Sabhiya Kaccāna was staying at Nādika in the brick house.

segments.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yenāyasmā sabhiyo kaccāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sabhiyena kaccānena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to him, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ sabhiyaṃ kaccānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to Sabhiya Kaccāna:

segments.pli: “kiṃ nu kho bho, kaccāna, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Master Kaccāna, does a Realized One exist after death?”
“Vaccha, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho kaccāna, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One not exist after death?”
“This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho kaccāna, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One both exist and not exist after death?”
“This has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.
“Kiṃ pana, bho kaccāna, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One neither exist nor not exist after death?”
“This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.
“‘Kiṃ nu kho, bho kaccāna, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
segments.en: “Master Kaccāna, when asked these questions, you say that this has not been declared by the Buddha.

segments.pli: ‘Kiṃ pana, bho kaccāna, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.
‘Kiṃ nu kho, bho kaccāna, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.
‘Kiṃ pana, bho kaccāna, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.
Ko nu kho, bho kaccāna, hetu, ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ samaṇena gotamenā”ti?
segments.en: What’s the cause, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Yo ca, vaccha, hetu, yo ca paccayo paññāpanāya rūpīti vā arūpīti vā saññīti vā asaññīti vā nevasaññīnāsaññīti vā, so ca hetu, so ca paccayo sabbena sabbaṃ sabbathā sabbaṃ aparisesaṃ nirujjheyya.
segments.en: “In order to describe him as ‘possessing form’ or ‘formless’ or ‘percipient’ or ‘non-percipient’ or ‘neither percipient nor non-percipient’, there must be some cause or reason for doing so. But if that cause and reason were to totally and utterly cease without anything left over,

segments.pli: Kena naṃ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya rūpīti vā arūpīti vā saññīti vā asaññīti vā nevasaññīnāsaññīti vā”ti.
segments.en: how could you describe him in any such terms?”
“Master Kaccāna, how long has it been since you went forth?”
“Not long, reverend: three years.”

segments.pli: “Yassapassa, āvuso, etamettakena ettakameva tampassa bahu, ko pana vādo evaṃ abhikkante”ti.
segments.en: “Well, you’ve learned a lot already, let alone what lies ahead!”
The Linked Discourses on undeclared questions are complete.
The Book of the Aggregates is finished.

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta asks Venerable Sabhiya Kaccāna whether a Realized One exists after death. He answers that the basis for describing a Realized One no longer applies. Vacchagotta is impressed that such a junior monk understands this subtle matter.
